				xlabel={$\lambda_{}$}, ylabel={$x$},

			\addplot[dashed, smooth, thick,blue] table[] {\DWunstableNoNoise};

			\addplot[color=black,solid,thick,mark=*, mark options={fill=black}]
				coordinates {(3,1.68)};

		\end{axis}

	%\caption{Pseudo-arclength parameter continuation. Predictions (white circles) are made from known equilibria (black circles) using a Secant method then a Newton-Raphson corrector to converge to the equilibria of the system (blue line) (left). The pseudo-arclength method enables the continuation around simple folds (right). \label{fig:continuation}}
\end{figure}
